isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB

svcsubproc.title: General Guidelines for Removal
svcsubproc.para: The following steps provide a guideline sequence for cab removal. The details of the removal procedure vary for different vehicle models, and for special equipment and accessories.

step1.para: Block the vehicle wheels and release the parking brake.
Drain the air from the air system.
On 5000 SBA (with fiberglass tilt hood), 5000 SFA and 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 models, tilt the hood forward and remove the air cleaner ducts, if required.

On 5000 SBA models (with butterfly hood, optional after August 1994), remove the hood, stay rods and air cleaner ducts. Refer to GROUP 09 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Discharge the air conditioning system and disconnect the system lines, if so equipped. Refer to GROUP 16 - CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the proper procedures.

warning.para: Refrigerant must be recovered from the air conditioning system before any components of the system are removed or replaced. Removing components while pressure is in the system will cause personal injury or death.

Always use approved refrigerant recycling equipment when working with R-12 and HFC-134a. The refrigerant evaporates very quickly and may displace the oxygen surrounding the work area, creating the hazard of suffocation or brain damage, especially in small or enclosed areas. Federal and state laws require that R-12 refrigerant be recovered and recycled to help protect the environment.

step1.para: Disconnect the battery ground cable and the frame-to-cab ground cable.
Remove the steering gear universal joint at the steering gear.
Disconnect the accelerator linkage and cruise-control, if so equipped.
Disconnect the wiring harness connectors from the cab dash and floor panels.
Disconnect the heater hoses, the clutch linkage, the engine shut-off control cable, the brake air lines and hoses, and the auxiliary oil filter hose.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Remove the transmission gearshift lever. Refer to GROUP - 13, TRANSMISSION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Detach any other connections between the cab and frame, if required.

svcsubproc.para: The following steps provide a guideline sequence for cab removal for the 5000 and 9000 Series vehicles.

step1.para: To remove the cab for the 9200, 9300 and 9400 models (before and after July 1996) and 9100 day cab model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove the hex bolt, flat washer, insulator retainer and hex lock nut (Items 8, 9, 18, and 14) securing the front cab mounting bracket (Item 20), located on the engine side of the cab cowl, to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 19), both sides.

Remove the hex bolts, flat washers, springs, rebound insulators, rebound insulator retainers and hex lock nuts (Items 1 through 6 and 16) securing the upper rear mounting bracket (Item 7) to the lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 11).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing the cab from the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift the cab off the chassis and place it on a padded surface to prevent damage to the cab assembly and paint.

svcsubproc.title: 9100/9200/9300/9400 - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 69 and Figure 70 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install the cab for the 9200, 9300 and 9400 models (before and after July 1996) and 9100 day cab model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: If removed, install the chassis front cab mounting bracket and insulator (Items 19 and 10) to the chassis, both sides. Tighten to 115 to 140 in-lbs. (13 to 16 Nm).
If removed, install the upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 7) to back of cab and install hex bolts, flat washers and lockwashers (Item 13). Tighten to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (41 to 51 Nm).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing the cab on the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift the cab into position over the chassis.

Slowly lower the cab down to the chassis. Position the cab so the front cab mounting bracket bolt holes line up with the chassis front cab mounting bracket bolt holes, then install the mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install hex bolt with flat washer (Items 8 and 9) through front cab mounting bracket, front mount insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Items 20, 10 and 19), both sides.
Then install the insulator retainer and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 14), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position the rear of the cab so the upper rear cab mounting bracket bolt holes line up with the lower rear cab mounting bracket bolt holes.
On the 9200, 9300 and 9400 models (before July 1996), install the rear mounting hardware as follows.
Refer to Figure 69 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Install the hex bolts with flat washers, springs, rebound insulators and rebound insulator retainers (Items 1 thru 5) through the upper rear cab mounting bracket, insulators and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Items 7, 12 and 11).
Then install the rebound insulator retainers, rebound insulators, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Items 6, 4, 2 and 16).
Cab mounting brackets and chassis mounting brackets to be balanced to equal distance laterally to assure that the cab is square to the chassis before tightening bolts.
With the cab located properly, tighten the front cab mounting bracket hex bolt and hex lock nut (Items 8 and 14), both sides, to 70 to 85 ft-lbs. (95 to 115 Nm).
With the cab located properly, tighten the rear cab mounting bracket hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 1 and 16). Tighten bolts until top washer is flush with top of sill.

step1.para: On 9200, 9300 and 9400 models (after July 1996) and 9100 day cab model, install rear mounting hardware as follows.
Refer to Figure 70 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Install the hex bolts with flat washers, springs, rebound insulators and rebound insulator retainers (Items 1 thru 5) through the upper rear cab mounting bracket, insulators and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Items 7, 12 and 11).
Then install the rebound insulator retainers, rebound insulators and flanged hex lock nuts (Items 6, 4 and 16).
Cab mounting brackets and chassis mounting brackets to be balanced to equal distance laterally to assure that the cab is square to the chassis before tightening bolts.
With the cab located properly, tighten the front cab mounting bracket hex bolt and hex lock nut (Items 8 and 14) to 145 to 175 ft-lbs. (197 to 237 Nm).
With the cab located properly, tighten the rear cab mounting bracket hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 1 and 16). Tighten bolt until top washer is flush with top of sill.

step1.para: To remove the cab for the 5000 SFA (before August 1996), use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove the flanged hex bolt and flanged hex lock nut (Items 12 and 15, View Circle A) securing the front cab mounting bracket (Item 8, View Circle A), located on the engine side of the cab cowl, to the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 9, View Circle A), both sides.
Remove the hex bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 1) securing the upper rear mounting bracket (Item 2) to the lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 3).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing the cab from the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift the cab off the chassis. Once the front cab mounting bracket (Item 8, View Circle A) has cleared the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 9, View Circle A), remove the 2 mounting bracket bushings and spacer (Items 13 and 14, View Circle A).
Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to the cab assembly and paint.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SFA (Before August 1996) - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 71 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install the cab for the 5000 SFA (before August 1996), use the following procedure.

step2.para: If removed, install the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 9) to the chassis, both sides. Tighten to 70 to 85 ft-lbs. (95 to 115 Nm).
If removed, install the upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 2) to the back of the cab and install hex bolts, lock- washers and flat washers (Item 11). Tighten to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (41 to 51 Nm).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing the cab on the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift the cab into position over the chassis.

Carefully lower the cab down to the chassis. Just before the front cab mounting bracket (Item 8, View Circle A) is placed on the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 9, View Circle A), position the spacer and mounting bracket bushings (Items 14 and 13, View Circle A) in place on the chassis front cab mounting bracket.

Lower the cab so the front cab mounting bracket bolt hole lines up with the chassis front cab mounting bracket bolt hole. This will hold the spacer and mounting bracket bushings (Items 14 and 13, View Circle A) in place, then install the mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install the flanged hex bolt (Item 12, View Circle A) through the front cab mounting bracket and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Items 8 and 9, View Circle A), both sides.
Then install the flanged hex lock nut (Item 15, View Circle A), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position the rear of the cab so the upper rear cab mounting bracket bolt holes line up with the lower rear cab mounting bracket bolt holes.
Install the hex bolts with flat washers (Item 1) through the upper rear cab mounting bracket and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Items 2 and 3) and install the hex lock nuts (Item 1).

With the cab located properly, tighten the front cab mounting bracket flanged hex bolt and flanged hex lock nut (Items 12 and 15, View Circle A), both sides. Tighten to 200 to 240 ft-lbs. (271 to 325 Nm).
With the cab located properly, tighten the rear cab mounting bracket hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Item 1) to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (41 to 51 Nm).

step1.para: To remove the cab for the 5000 SBA and SFA (after August 1996), use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove the flanged hex bolt and flanged hex lock nut (Items 15 and 18, View Circle A) securing the front cab mounting bracket (Item 14, View Circle A), located on the engine side of the cab cowl, to the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 13, View Circle A), both sides.

Remove the hex bolts, flat washers, springs, cab mounting insulators, insulator retainers and hex lock nuts (Items 1 thru 6) securing the upper rear mounting bracket (Item 7) to the lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 9).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing the cab from the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift the cab off the chassis. Once the front cab mounting bracket (Item 14, View Circle A) has cleared the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 13, View Circle A), remove the 2 mounting bracket bushings and spacer (Items 16 and 17, View Circle A).
Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to the cab assembly and paint.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA and SFA (After August 1996) - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 72 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install the cab for the 5000 SBA and SFA (after August 1996), use the following procedure.

step2.para: If removed, install the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 13) to the chassis, both sides. Tighten to 70 to 85 ft-lbs. (95 to 115 Nm).
If removed, install the upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 7) to the back of the cab and install hex bolts, lock- washers and flat washers (Item 19). Tighten to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (41 to 51 Nm).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing the cab on the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift the cab into position over the chassis.

Carefully lower the cab down to the chassis. Just before the front cab mounting bracket (Item 14, View Circle A) is placed on the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 13, View Circle A), position the spacer and mounting bracket bushings (Items 17 and 16) in place on the chassis front cab mounting bracket.

Lower the cab so the front cab mounting bracket bolt hole lines up with the chassis front cab mounting bracket bolt hole. This will hold the spacer and mounting bracket bushings (Items 17 and 16) in place, then install the mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install the flanged hex bolt (Item 15, View Circle A) through the front cab mounting bracket and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Items 14 and 13, View Circle A), both sides.
Then install the flanged hex lock nut (Item 18), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position the rear of the cab so the upper rear cab mounting bracket bolt holes line up with the lower rear cab mounting bracket bolt holes and install the mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install the hex bolts with flat washers, springs, cab mounting insulators and insulator retainers (Items 1 thru 5) through the upper rear cab mounting bracket, insulators and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Items 7, 8 and 9).
Then install the insulator retainers, cab mounting insulators, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Items 5, 4, 2 and 6).
With the cab located properly, tighten the front cab mounting bracket flanged hex bolt and flanged hex lock nut (Items 15 and 18), both sides, to 200 to 240 ft-lbs. (271 to 325 Nm).
With the cab located properly, tighten the rear cab mounting bracket hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 1 and 6); tighten bolts until top washer is flush with top of sill.

svcsubproc.title: General Guidelines For Installation
svcsubproc.para: The following steps provide a guideline sequence for cab installation. The details of the installation procedure vary for different vehicle models, and for special equipment and accessories.

step1.para: Install the transmission gear shift lever. Refer to GROUP 13 - TRANSMISSION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Connect the heater hoses, the clutch linkage, the engine shut-off control cable, the brake air lines and hoses, and the auxiliary oil filter hose.
Connect the wiring harness connectors to the cab dash and floor panels.
Connect the accelerator linkage and cruise-control, if so equipped.
Install the steering gear universal joint at the steering gear.
Connect the battery ground cable and the frame-to-cab ground cable.
Attach any other connections between the cab and the frame, if required.
Connect the air conditioning system, if so equipped and charge the system lines. Refer to GROUP 16 - CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the proper procedures.
Charge the air system.
Square the cab relative to the frame, if required. Refer to CAB SQUARING.
Remove the blocks from the wheels and road test the vehicle before returning it to service.

svcsubproc.title: Paint as Required
svcsubproc.para: To paint a replaced or repaired panel, refer to GROUP 16 - CAB in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: Re-Install Related Components
svcsubproc.para: To install removed components, refer to the proper section in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
